headline: Delhi records more than 6,000 COVID-19 cases in 24hrs for the 1st time
summary: Delhi has registered a record 6,725 new cases of coronavirus in the last 24 hours, which is the highest single-day tally since the outbreak in the national capital. Meanwhile, 3,610 recoveries and 48 deaths have also been recorded in Delhi. The total number of cases in the national capital now stands at 4,03,096, including 3,60,069 recoveries.

headline: Javed Akhtar sues Kangana for defamation over statement on Hrithik Roshan
summary: Lyricist Javed Akhtar has filed a defamation case against Kangana Ranaut for repeated allegations that he summoned her to his residence and threatened her for speaking out about her alleged relationship with Hrithik Roshan. Javed said the video interview given by Kangana has affected his reputation. He also alleged Kangana is dragging his name in Sushant Singh Rajput's death case.

headline: What are the milestones in Joe Biden's 48-year political career?
summary: Joe Biden was elected as a US Senator from Delaware for the first time in 1972 at the age of 29 and served there for 36 years. Prior to becoming a Senator, Biden had served two years on a county board in Delaware. He first ran for US President in 1988 and then in 2008 before dropping out.

headline: Sandeep sets record for taking most wickets in powerplay in IPL, overtakes Zaheer
summary: SRH fast bowler Sandeep Sharma has set the all-time record for taking most wickets in powerplay in IPL, achieving the feat after dismissing MI's Quinton de Kock in the fifth over today. Sandeep has now taken 53 wickets in the powerplay in IPL. The previous record was held by Zaheer Khan, who had taken 52 wickets.

headline: After Shanghai, Ant Group's $37 bn IPO suspended in Hong Kong
summary: Ant Group's $37 billion IPO was suspended in Hong Kong shortly after the Shanghai stock exchange suspended it. The IPO was set for November 5 and would have been the world's largest IPO. The suspensions follow a recent meeting of China's top financial regulators with Ant Group Founder Jack Ma and its top executives.

headline: K'taka to enact law banning religious conversions for marriage: Minister
summary: Karnataka Tourism Minister CT Ravi on Tuesday said a law banning religious conversions for the sake of marriage would be enacted in the state. Ravi added that the government would not remain silent when "jihadis strip the dignity of women" in the state. He further said that anyone involved in any act of conversion would face severe and swift punishment.

headline: Delhi HC acquits 2 in 2011 murder case, says police planted witness
summary: Delhi High Court on Monday acquitted two convicts in a 2011 murder case and asked the Police Commissioner to look into the conduct of the investigation. The HC said a constable projected by police as an eyewitness was planted to "solve" the case. "Because of the IO and SHO's lackadaisical approach, the entire investigation has been botched," the HC added.

headline: Central Vista project would save ₹1k cr annually in rent: Centre to SC
summary: Centre on Tuesday told Supreme Court that the ₹20,000 crore Central Vista redevelopment project would "save money" instead of wasting it. It would save ₹1,000 crore paid annually as rent for housing central government ministries in Delhi, Solicitor General Tushar Mehta told SC. Centre said there is a shortfall of about 0.38 million square metres in office space for ministries.

headline: I slimmed down for 'Miss India': Keerthy on physical transformation
summary: Actress Keerthy Suresh, while talking about her physical transformation, said that she lost weight for her upcoming film, 'Miss India', because her character demanded it. "I started working out more after...release of 'Mahanati' (2018)," Keerthy said, adding, "'Miss India' is one of the reasons why I slimmed down. Director...told me...I need to look slim so any dress would fit me."

headline: Akshay taught us to be careful on set amid COVID-19: Bell Bottom actor
summary: Actor Anirudh Dave, who completed the shooting of Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Bell Bottom' amid the coronavirus pandemic, has started shooting for his TV show, 'Lockdown Ki Love Story'. Talking about resuming work, Anirudh said, "Akshay sir has already taught us to be careful on set...in this pandemic situation. We all have to come out from our homes and start working."

headline: Trump says he has 'solid chance of winning' as voting begins in US
summary: As voting began in the US Presidential election, President Donald Trump said that he has a "solid chance of winning". "We think we are winning Texas very big. We think we are winning Florida very big. We think we are winning Arizona very big," he added. "We think we are doing very well everywhere," he added.

headline: Kohli should open for RCB, if they don't want to play Finch: Nehra
summary: Ex-India pacer Ashish Nehra has said that RCB skipper Virat Kohli should open the batting for the franchise if they don't include Aaron Finch in the playing XI. "There was a lot of pressure on Kohli [against DC]. It wasn't easy to hit Ravichandran Ashwin and Axar Patel," he added. So far, Kohli has scored 460 runs this season.

headline: Ex-Man Utd player and Wales manager arrested for assaulting girlfriend
summary: Ex-Manchester United player and Wales manager Ryan Giggs was arrested by police for allegedly assaulting his girlfriend Kate Greville at their house on Sunday night. While Giggs has now been released on bail pending enquiries, he has denied all allegations of the assault. "A woman in her 30s sustained minor injuries," a report quoted police as saying over the incident.

headline: E-voting allowed for COVID-19 affected officers in GHMC polls
summary: The Telangana State Election Commission (SEC) on Monday decided to allow e-voting on pilot basis for polling officers, those in quarantine due to COVID-19 and senior citizens in the upcoming GHMC elections. The SEC discussed the technical issues involved with officials and requested them to give a demonstration on the software to be used for this purpose.

headline: Scientists develop faster way of detecting antibiotic resistance in bacteria
summary: The University of Sheffield revealed scientists have developed a quicker way of detecting resistance in bacteria. The method uses nanotechnology to detect antibiotic resistance in approximately 45 minutes. This could improve people's ability to "prescribe antibiotics correctly" and "reduce the misuse of antibiotic treatments". The method doesn't require the bacteria to be immobilised.

headline: Rise in groundwater levels in Hyd after rains in Oct: TGWD data
summary: As per Telangana Groundwater Department (TGWD) data, following heavy rains in Hyderabad last month, the groundwater levels have recorded a significant rise in October. Telangana's average groundwater level improved to 4.22 metres below ground level (mbgl) in October, compared to 5.38 mbgl in September, 11.28 mbgl in May and 7.92 mbgl in October 2019.

headline: Pune hospital doctors go on mass leave as a mark of protest
summary: As many as 69 assistant professors and doctors from BJ Medical College and Sassoon General Hospital have gone on mass leave to protest over various demands, including regularisation of their jobs and hike in salary. One of the assistant professors said that they have sought COVID-19 "warrior" status as they have been working tirelessly for the last six months.

headline: G'gram civic body identifies 14 spots to curb air-pollution in city
summary: Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) and Centre for Science and Environment (CSE) have come together to formulate action plans to reduce air-pollution by identifying 14 hotspots across the city. It includes 10 most-polluted sites, three most-congested stretches and the solitary landfill. While Sohna Road is among the most-congested stretches, DLF-4, DLF-5 are among the most-polluted.

headline: CISF head constable burnt to death after heater catches fire in Delhi
summary: A 43-year-old CISF head constable in Delhi died after he suffered burn injuries due to the heater he was using at the Indira Gandhi Smriti. Police said that the head constable suffered burns after his heater caught fire. Doctors had earlier told the police that the head constable suffered 60% burn injuries and was unfit to give a statement.

headline: US man gets 25 yrs in jail for setting fire to 3 Black churches
summary: A US man has been sentenced to 25 years in prison for setting three historically Black churches on fire, federal prosecutors said on Monday. Holden Matthews had pleaded guilty in February for burning the churches last year. The sentence will be shortened by 18 months for the time he has already spent in jail, the Federal District Judge said.

headline: If elected, I will work with both Democrats and Republicans: Biden
summary: Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden tweeted that if he is elected as the President of the United States, he would work with both the Democrats and Republicans because "that's the job of a president". "I'm running as a proud Democrat, but I will govern as an American president," he added. Voting is underway in the US.

headline: N Korea is building submarine that can fire SLBMs: S Korean lawmaker
summary: A South Korean lawmaker said that North Korea is building two new submarines, including one capable of firing submarine-launched ballistic missiles (SLBMs). "One is a modified Romeo Class and the other is a new medium-large size one," he added. Last year, North Korea said that it had successfully test-fired a new SLBM from the sea.

headline: India's Oct trade deficit narrows to $8.78 bn; exports fall 5.4%
summary: India's trade deficit for October narrowed to $8.78 billion, as against a trade deficit of $11.76 billion a year ago, an improvement by 25.34%, according to government data. The country's exports fell 5.4% to $24.82 billion in October from $26.23 billion in October 2019, while imports fell 11.56% to $33.6 billion. Exports during the April-October period stood at $150.07 billion.

headline: No increase in service charges by any public sector bank: Govt
summary: The Finance Ministry has clarified that service charges haven't been increased by any public sector bank. Bank of Baroda had made changes related to number of free cash deposits and withdrawals but it has withdrawn the changes due to COVID-19 pandemic, it said. No service charge is applicable on the 60.04 crore basic savings bank deposit accounts, the ministry added.

headline: GST borrowing to meet shortfall must be reasonable: Finance Secy
summary: Finance Secretary Ajay Bhushan Pandey said that the quantum of borrowing to meet states' GST revenue shortfall has to be "reasonable" considering its economic impact. The Centre will continue to request opposition-ruled states, like Kerala, Punjab and West Bengal, to opt for the proposed borrowing plan, he added. So far, 21 states and 3 UTs have opted for the plan.

headline: Malabar Naval Exercise kicks off, China says ‘hope it is conducive to peace’
summary: Malabar exercise 2020 comes at a time when the ties of all the four participating nations are at a significant low with the major power in the region –- China.

headline: Haryana: Industry to get Rs 48k annual subsidy per local employee for 7 years
summary: Deputy CM Dushyant Chautala, who also holds the portfolio of Industries & Commerce and Labour & Employment, announced this after presiding over a meeting of the top officials of his departments on Haryana Enterprises and Employment Policy-2020 (HEPP-2020), Tuesday.

headline: Javed Akhtar files defamation case against Kangana Ranaut
summary: The complaint, filed before the Metropolitan Magistrate at Andheri, Mumbai, claims Ranaut made the defamatory comments in a video interview to a TV channel.

headline: Kerala: Why CM Vijayan said central probe agencies out to ‘malign, destabilise’ his govt
summary: In connection with the investigation into the gold smuggling case, the ED has sought details of some Kerala government schemes, irking Pinarayi Vijayan.

headline: ‘Karnataka to bring law banning religious conversions for marriage’: Tourism Minister C T Ravi
summary: BJP-ruled states of Uttar Pradesh and Haryana have also announced their intention of bringing a legislation to deal with cases of 'love jihad'.

headline: Amarinder Singh to sit on dharna at Rajghat tomorrow as power crisis grips Punjab
summary: The crisis, triggered by the suspension of goods trains, aggravated further in the state, resulting in complete shut-down of all power plants as well as curtailment of agricultural and vegetable supplies.

headline: Preparations on for second wave, Punjab to expand contact tracing to 15
summary: To streamline and prioritise the process of Covid vaccination, the Chief Minister ordered a state-level 3-tier vaccine supervision mechanism, comprising a steering committee as well as state and district task force, to be put in place.

headline: Punjab records first monthly dip in Covid cases, Captain orders Sero survey
summary: The month-long Sero survey would also determine whether it was herd immunity that led to a consistent decrease in new cases in the state.

headline: FIR filed against Amitabh Bachchan, KBC makers for ‘hurting Hindu sentiments’
summary: The KBC episode question annoyed some netizens who accused the show of running a "leftist propaganda", while others said it hurt Hindu sentiments.

headline: Rebel Congress MLA seeks probe into Rae Bareli Trust, writes to EO
summary: Aditi Singh hit out at her party “colleagues and seniors”, saying that while they question PM Cares Fund, they shy away from maintaining “transparency and accountability in their own family-run societies”.

headline: Two cops suspended for Sardhana blast, police probe ‘explosive cache’
summary: The decision to suspend two policemen came a day after local BJP MLA Sangeet SOM demanded a high-level probe into the explosion.

headline: SP leader held for ‘threatening’ woman over property dispute
summary: In her complaint, the woman said Nadeem Ahmad Farooqui and his associate Shamim own a plot of land just behind her house.

headline: Days after quitting Cong, former Unnao MP Annu Tandon joins SP
summary: Tandon praised Akhilesh Yadav calling him a “young, progressive and visionary” leader with all the qualities expected from a leader.

headline: Rajya Sabha polls: SC tells Prakash Bajaj to approach High Court
summary: Bajaj had alleged a conspiracy by the Returning Officer and other officials in the rejection of his nomination paper to favour the BSP candidate.

headline: Allahabad HC reserves order in Hathras case, orders  CBI to file status report
summary: The High Court also directed the CBI to file a status report by November 25, the next date of hearing, said senior advocate Jaideep Narain Mathur, who has been appointed amicus curiae in the case.

headline: Bypolls 2020 Live Updates: MP voters know that CM Chouhan has just lied in 6 months, says Kamal Nath
summary: Bye-Election 2020 Live News Updates: Voting will be held from 7 AM to 6 PM, except in Chhattisgarh, Jharkhand and Nagaland, where the timings are different. The number of people allowed in a polling booth has been restricted.

headline: Tying rakhi as bail condition: AG for gender sensitisation
summary: Venugopal suggested that programmes of the National and state judicial Academy must have sessions on gender sensitisation.

headline: Goa law college stands by professor, tells ABVP teacher will not be sacked
summary: Outsider has no locus standi to raise such objections, rules committee after probing complaint that teacher 'promotes socially hateful thoughts about a particular religion'

headline: Pinarayi Vijayan slams central agencies: Exceeding authority, probe being diverted to suit certain vested interests
summary: Vijayan told the media that these agencies have exceeded their authority and their actions are a clear violation of the federal norms of the country.

headline: Timing of Jagan letter suspect, but no consent for contempt: AG
summary: Letter followed Justice Ramana order to fast-track cases: Venugopal

headline: Jharkhand scholarship scam: Have started probe, says Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi
summary: Speaking to The Indian Express after chairing a high-level meeting to discuss the issue, Naqvi said: “We have initiated an investigation into the matter and are in constant touch with the state government.”

headline: Jharkhand scholarship scam: Fraud went on unchecked even as red flags were waved in Centre and state
summary: On Sunday, Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren reacted to the findings by ordering a probe and promising to revamp the verification system. Chief Secretary Sukhdev Singh said verification “has been stopped” till the probe is completed.

headline: First India-born minister in New Zealand, her father says ‘proud, not surprised’
summary: In New Zealand, Priyanca will be Minister for Diversity, Inclusion and Ethnic Communities; Minister for the Community and Voluntary Sector; and Associate Minister for Social Development and Employment.

headline: On table for next round of LAC talks: Thinning of troops
summary: Signal from Beijing on certain friction points as harsh Ladakh winter sets in

headline: Gujarat bypolls: 8,000 PPE kits, voting facility for Covid patients
summary: S Murali Krishna, Chief Electoral Officer (CEO) of Gujarat, said that total 566 polling stations were added to ensure that social distancing norms are not violated in the polling booths.
